summary.p:
A composite manuscript containing:
The date, ownership statement, title & and user's instruction of a copy of the Kumaracatakam (Indien 357a).
The Maṇavāḷanārārayaṇacatakam or Tiruvēṅkaṭacatakam, by Nārāyaṇapāratiyār (Indien 357b).
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (June 2021).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: the front cover. Shelfmark on the recto.

supportDesc.condition: Good state of preservation despite boreholes.

additions.desc:
Annotation in French in black ink on a sheet of paper, related to the content of Indien 357b:
morale
N° 8
Poème de Vengandavalame sous le nom
de Manavalanarayaneine ou
poème satyrique en vers sur les
l’humanité: lavenir , du méchant
du prodigue vaniteux, des femmes
l’auteur prend a témoin, vingadafsalame, (de leur)
et s’efforce par le tableau des desordres
qui en sont la suite à les ramener dans
la voie de la vérité
complet
sans mention de l’auteur
BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 357 (front cover, recto).

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: Both components (Indien 357a and Indien 357b) are dated internally to the year carvacittu of the Jovian cycle, that is, CE 1887-1888, 1827-1828, 1767-1768, 1707-1708, etc. Not dated by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) nor by Cabaton (1912).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 52.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 81r, no. 331 357.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
